one_reviews_text:
Don't like the sudden close-up view of a tyrannosaurus. How to skip it?  Is there more after it? 
Also hate to see the zombie whenever back to homepage.

review_title: The toppest graphic quality u ever see
one_reviews_text:
I wish the rest of the VR games/applications used this engine or this technology; it's extraordinry. The graphic seen in this part will not be experienced in 99.9% of other applications you are about to see! 
CON: Too short and it has some very low quality qraphic mixed
to short to play

review_title: Terrific intro to VR and I still use it
one_reviews_text: Latest update has added some great new scenes. This is a really well done intro with all of the various environments, as short as they are, they are superb.
AMASING GOOD FOR CALMING
A great introduction to vr.

review_title: I want to like this app, I really do.
one_reviews_text:
Firstly I've been a long time (on and off) user of this application. By this I mean I've seen it go thru numerous versions and the experience is always the same. When it works well it merits 5 stars and when it doesn't it gets 1 star (thus the average 3 star rating).

About a month ago it was running flawlessly and then in what seems to be the developers' SOP (standard operating procedure) they do an update that renders it either very frustrating or useless.  The latest update seems to have done the latter. Although I hear sound in my environment or people around me I get no sound from any video I watch (and yes, I have installed the audio driver Bigscreen asks me to install).  :(

However, I still have hope that the problem will be fixed. It definitely isn't as bad as a version from early 2018 that was so broken I unistalled the application.

C'mon devs give me a reason to love this app again.

Oculus WORST Customer service ever!!

Game is terrible because my Original Oculus Rift is broken. Cable broke & Oculus support will not replace or even sell me a headset cable. Now I have a $500 paper weight!!!
T-rex was great!

This is a good demo to show others as an introduction to VR.
There's no controls in the scenes, just look around and enjoy.


(Played with HTC Vive Cosmos on ReVive)
I had the full version for over a year now but whenever I run it these days it only shows 4 scenes intead of 10.  How do I get it back to the 10?
This is one of the best VR Demos to show off. But for some reason it only loads the last three scenes in the latest release. PLEASE FIX IT!
The T rex is epic,whole experience is fantastic

This should have been an excellent demo to show off VR to guests, but the Guardian System is not working.
The headset position is tracked but the position of the hand controllers is ignored. I realise that you do not need to move your hands around to get the demo to work but that's not the point. Having half the Guardian system not work is not good. I know it is a free demo, but even "free" should not be dangerous. If the hand controllers are to be ignored, then a Health and Safety warning at the start of the demo should say so.
Please fully implement the Guardian system because this could easily be made excellent.
This is a great introduction to VR.
Come  on we want more, tease
Anyone new to VR should have seen Dreamdeck at least once. It's a great experience and it's free.
This is a great way to introduce people to the world of VR and the possibilities that it offers... but maybe steer nervous folks away from the T Rex.
great for showing off VR to newbz

review_title: great to show for first starters.
one_reviews_text:
yes there is a bug so be cautions. The guardian system did not regocnise your touch controlers, but only the head. but if you figure this out its maybe to late. ;)

And its free. :)
sick it worked well just fix that bug!
Amazing experience!
This app shows it all, must have!
Showed it to my parents and they loved it! It's free, folks.

review_title: Great but there is a bug !!
one_reviews_text: The guardian limits dont work correctly on the beta (23.03.2018). Needs a fix !
I think that the graphics of this game are extroadinary, but if this could actually become a playable game with an open world this would be considered he best VR game!

review_title: Great little app to showcase your Rift.
one_reviews_text: This is perfect for those who are interested in experiencing some VR but not fully committed to interacting.  It will take you through a series of scenes to watch in awe if you're new to the virtual world.  Highly recommended for demonstrations.
Nice!!
graphic is pretty good, but it not a game, mostly like VR movie
gooooooooooood

I did enjoy the various scene in this demo; they are well made to put you in the center of what is going on, so you can experience VR. Perfect if you want to show someone what VR is all about.

I would improve this with some interactivity; as is now it is a slideshow of scenes, where you can simply look around and nothing more.
A few areas that you visit and they change every 30 seconds or so. Its fun to see one time, but something you will uninstall right after.
This is pretty cool. Graphics are amazing.

review_title: A nice introduction to the VR
one_reviews_text: The demo presents you with 8 different scenes some of which are really, really good, others... Less so. It's a nice thing to show to your friends.
Different scenes with different sensations. I love it! This is the experience to show first to your friends
great intro to VR

Definitely one to show off the concept of VR. Wouldn't recommend to people who get scared easily. I can see how this would freak someone out who is new to VR. But overall, really well done and excellent execution.

review_title: It's not working anymore and cannot..
one_reviews_text: I had 8 scenes and then one day only 4 (where are the lost 4?). I cannot unistall it and reinstall it, Oculus app does not allow to uninstall it. And you cannot start it from the oculus home. So I am stuck with a dead weight on my HD. Thank you Oculus, great design.

T - Rex.
I cant move I cant move!!! $#&% $#&% $#&% OKAY JUST EAT ME!

I've been playing VR for two weeks now. And I physically coward down. Scale, ladies and gentlemen, has been achieved.
Show your friends this!
Fantastic first experience in Rift. Really impressed at the quality of the sets. Always on my demo list.

A good way to quickly show people the scale and 3D capability of VR. There is no interaction or game here but as a free quick demo it's useful to be able to have first time VR'ers get a quick and simple experience.

With the deer and bunny (or is it fox?). I have to always skip it when showing to people, because it's embarassing and disappointing . It just doesn't have the wow like the rest. Other than that, it's perfect introduction to VR
Loved the dinosaurs. Wow!
Pretty looking, but it lasts for maybe 5 minutes and that is it. You are just an observer. Don't bother.

review_title: Superb Demo to Showcase Your Oculus
one_reviews_text:
You can select which experience you want, I just wish you could stay as long as you want instead of it ending after a predefined amount of time.

Stand inside a submarine.
Watch two robots fight to music.
Explore a microsopic bug.
Avoid a T-Rex.
Enjoy a scenic riverside cartoon.
See a cartoon city in God-mode.
Stand high above a city atop a skyscraper.
Shows you what is possible in the VR :-)
brilliant collection of spaces that introduce you nicely to the world of vr

This one is a good one, don't get me wrong, but as it happen with the VERY FEW good VR experiences out there, this one is away too short. This is a shame, because 99% of all VR contents today are OVER PRICED, and they are nothing but garbage. I really hope that it is gonna change, since VR it still in its infancy...

+: Nice visuals - even the first section regardless of what some others have said; I was actually less impressed with the dinosaur overall.
-: Way too short with no controls over environment or experience - in particular the fact that you cannot stay in the environment you are currently viewing.
-: Option to skip a scene did not seem to work with Oculus Touch.
-: No interactivity.

amazing to have company try out vr for the first time. watching their expressions as you explain you can move around and duck / peek over objects is priceless. 

hope at some point they make a 2.0 version with some mildly interactive enviroments for touch

This app has been the first introduction to VR for so many, that it has earned its place in VR history. Every short experience highlights different aspects of VR from the fear of hights, to presence with low poly, to 3D audio, to the magic of being face-to-face with an alien.
Worth watching just for the T-Rex.
A nice comfy intro to VR, showing great graphics potential for the future.

review_title: Maybe you could call it Nightmare Deck?
one_reviews_text: I don't really want to give this a bad review, because there's some great VR in this. It just wasn't what I was expecting based on the name, vague description, and the comfortable rating. I'm not  new to VR, but I found some of the scenes to be pretty intense. Suddenly finding myself within arms length of a realistic T-Rex with no warning was NOT comfortable for me. If there had been some indication before the scene changed that there was going to be a T-Rex, that might have been different. Being able to choose the scene you want would be even better.
Perfect showcase for everyone who wants to present the capabilities of the Rift.
Internal error ovr75318303 followed the suggestions in the forum, re installed Oculus software still will not start

This was a fun one when you first start it. You can view either standing up or sitting down real life objects that interact with you. By far the best scene in this is the T-Rex. Gotta been there to experiance true epicness.
A MUST HAVE for all starters no matter what!!
This is my mandatory app to play for the demo experience I make my friends do to try oculus for the first time: it does what it's supposed to, making the guest just sit and relax watching the show

review_title: dont delay....grab this VR show off
one_reviews_text:
I have yet to see anything VR wise in alot of released VR show offs that ever rises to the 
quality of the T-REX scene.

A perfect way to introduce folks to VR (me included). It has a bit of everything, from the casual viewer (the little glade and the mask) to the thrill seekers (Dinosaur and the skyscrapper) to childen (the robotic arm duo and the cartoon village). Even the trippy x-ray spider was really convincing.
Top shelf stuff for a free demo! Well worth your bandwith.
Realistic graphics. Very immersive.
Always a great start when it comes to showing people VR for the first time. The T-Rex reaction always gets me xD

review_title: What a way to show off the potential!
one_reviews_text: Loved it!
SUCKS AND IT DOESINT EVEN LAST 4 1 MINUTE
Try it!

review_title: T-Rex is still among the best demos!
one_reviews_text: This was obviously my first experience with VR and I'll always remember it.  I was blown away by the immersion I felt.  The T-Rex actually triggered my body's instinct of fight or flight - actual fear even though I knew this was VR.  After that, I was hooked and have been addicted ever since.
Great demonstration!
I consitently use this to show people VR.  It is a mixed bag of good (Trex walking down hall, Little model city, Staring into the mirror, Alien, and bad (everything else).  Good for what it is

Short demos, nothing very interactive at all about any of them, but that's hardly the point. Get dinosaur spit in your face before a T-rex walks over you. Look down off a sky-scraper and feel your vertigo flare up. Marvel in childlike wonder at a tiny cartoon town. This is the first title to get loaded for anyone seeing VR for the first time at my hands. 5/5

Stuff like these are awesome to show friends and families what VR should look like. My only complaint is that there aren't more demos in it right now. And that I don't have Touch... But the Dreamdeck devs probably can't help me with that. :)

There are some cool scenes in this one, aspechally the dinosaur. But if you want to see him again you have to skip through the other ones first which is annoying. You can't stay as long as you want either. But after al it is just a quick introduction to VR that isn't meant to be played daily, so... Who cares right!?
First thing I show people when they wanna try VR

Perfect introduction to show VR capabilities to your friend.

Hope that Touch support will be added, and maybe more universes to explore ?
All of the demos are very polished. Just hoping they can add touch support to these so we can see our hands. No need for interaction either, I just want to see them there!
a very good very to show clearer VR experiences in 4K VR
This showed the true potential of VR.  Amazing.
a nice but brief VR introduction designed for VR noobs. Good for showing some possibilities to non gamers.

review_title: a good way to show people vr
one_reviews_text: its a nice demo.
Best intro ever!
Oculus gave us a suprise gift... this!  It is the absolute greatest intro to VR ever created.
